name: Rocky's Zesty Ham Croquettes
author: Rocco
summary: This recipe for ham croquettes is great for leftovers; it's a nice treat from the boring next-day ham and cheese sandwich or ham dinner.
directions: Grind ham into a large bowl
Beat 3 eggs in a small bowl
Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat
Add garlic and dried onion; cook and stir until browned, about 5 minutes
Pour mixture into the bowl with the ham; add the beaten eggs, 1 cup bread crumbs, Cheddar cheese, brown sugar, and black pepper
Mix by hand until combined; mold into 15 to 18 medium croquettes, or rectangular balls
Beat remaining 1 egg in a bowl with 1 tablespoon water
Pour remaining 2 cups bread crumbs into a large nonstick baking pan
Dip each croquette in the egg and roll in bread crumbs
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add croquettes; fry in batches until golden brown, about 10 minutes total
Place finished croquettes on a paper towels to drain excess oil
